verses.kjv: There was also a lot for the tribe of Manasseh; for he was the firstborn of Joseph; to wit, for Machir the firstborn of Manasseh, the father of Gilead: because he was a man of war, therefore he had Gilead and Bashan.
verses.web: This was the lot for the tribe of Manasseh, for he was the firstborn of Joseph. As for Machir the firstborn of Manasseh, the father of Gilead, because he was a man of war, therefore he had Gilead and Bashan.
verses.ct: Land was also allotted to the tribe of Manasseh, since he was Joseph's firstborn. Machir, Manasseh's firstborn and the father of Gilead, was a fierce warrior, so he had already received Gilead and Bashan.

verses.kjv: There was also a lot for the rest of the children of Manasseh by their families; for the children of Abiezer, and for the children of Helek, and for the children of Asriel, and for the children of Shechem, and for the children of Hepher, and for the children of Shemida: these were the male children of Manasseh the son of Joseph by their families.
verses.web: So this was for the rest of the children of Manasseh according to their families: for the children of Abiezer, for the children of Helek, for the children of Asriel, for the children of Shechem, for the children of Hepher, and for the children of Shemida. These were the male children of Manasseh the son of Joseph according to their families.
verses.ct: Land was also given to the rest of Manasseh's descendants, arranged by their families: the clans of Abiezer, Helek, Asriel, Shechem, Hepher, and Shemida. These were the male descendants of Manasseh son of Joseph, listed by their families.

verses.kjv: But Zelophehad, the son of Hepher, the son of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh, had no sons, but daughters: and these are the names of his daughters, Mahlah, and Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.
verses.web: But Zelophehad, the son of Hepher, the son of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh, had no sons, but daughters. These are the names of his daughters: Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.
verses.ct: Now Zelophehad — son of Hepher, son of Gilead, son of Machir, son of Manasseh — had no sons, only daughters. His daughters' names were Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.

verses.kjv: And they came near before Eleazar the priest, and before Joshua the son of Nun, and before the princes, saying, The LORD commanded Moses to give us an inheritance among our brethren. Therefore according to the commandment of the LORD he gave them an inheritance among the brethren of their father.
verses.web: They came to Eleazar the priest, and to Joshua the son of Nun, and to the princes, saying, “LORD commanded Moses to give us an inheritance among our brothers.” Therefore according to the commandment of LORD he gave them an inheritance among the brothers of their father.
verses.ct: These women went before Eleazar the priest, Joshua son of Nun, and the tribal leaders and said, "The LORD commanded Moses to give us an inheritance alongside our male relatives." So, following the LORD's command, Joshua gave them an inheritance among their father's relatives.

verses.kjv: And there fell ten portions to Manasseh, beside the land of Gilead and Bashan, which were on the other side Jordan;
verses.web: Ten parts fell to Manasseh, in addition to the land of Gilead and Bashan, which is beyond the Jordan;
verses.ct: This meant that Manasseh received 10 portions of land west of the Jordan, in addition to the territory of Gilead and Bashan on the east side.

verses.kjv: Because the daughters of Manasseh had an inheritance among his sons: and the rest of Manasseh’s sons had the land of Gilead.
verses.web: because the daughters of Manasseh had an inheritance among his sons. The land of Gilead belonged to the rest of the sons of Manasseh.
verses.ct: This was because Manasseh's daughters received an inheritance alongside his sons. The land of Gilead went to the rest of Manasseh's descendants.

verses.kjv: And the coast of Manasseh was from Asher to Michmethah, that lieth before Shechem; and the border went along on the right hand unto the inhabitants of Entappuah.
verses.web: The border of Manasseh was from Asher to Michmethath, which is before Shechem. The border went along to the right hand, to the inhabitants of En Tappuah.
verses.ct: Manasseh's border ran from Asher to Michmethah, which is east of Shechem. From there the border went south toward the people living at En Tappuah.

verses.kjv: Now Manasseh had the land of Tappuah: but Tappuah on the border of Manasseh belonged to the children of Ephraim;
verses.web: The land of Tappuah belonged to Manasseh; but Tappuah on the border of Manasseh belonged to the children of Ephraim.
verses.ct: The land around Tappuah belonged to Manasseh, but the town of Tappuah itself, sitting right on Manasseh's border, belonged to the people of Ephraim.

verses.kjv: And the coast descended unto the river Kanah, southward of the river: these cities of Ephraim are among the cities of Manasseh: the coast of Manasseh also was on the north side of the river, and the outgoings of it were at the sea:
verses.web: The border went down to the brook of Kanah, southward of the brook. These cities belonged to Ephraim among the cities of Manasseh. The border of Manasseh was on the north side of the brook, and ended at the sea.
verses.ct: The border continued down to the brook of Kanah. South of the brook, certain cities within Manasseh's territory actually belonged to Ephraim. Manasseh's border ran along the north side of the brook and ended at the Mediterranean Sea.

verses.kjv: Southward it was Ephraim’s, and northward it was Manasseh’s, and the sea is his border; and they met together in Asher on the north, and in Issachar on the east.
verses.web: Southward it was Ephraim’s, and northward it was Manasseh’s, and the sea was his border. They reached to Asher on the north, and to Issachar on the east.
verses.ct: The land south of the brook belonged to Ephraim, and the land north of it belonged to Manasseh, with the sea as his western border. To the north, Manasseh's territory touched Asher, and to the east it bordered Issachar.

verses.kjv: And Manasseh had in Issachar and in Asher Bethshean and her towns, and Ibleam and her towns, and the inhabitants of Dor and her towns, and the inhabitants of Endor and her towns, and the inhabitants of Taanach and her towns, and the inhabitants of Megiddo and her towns, even three countries.
verses.web: Manasseh had three heights in Issachar, in Asher Beth Shean and its towns, and Ibleam and its towns, and the inhabitants of Dor and its towns, and the inhabitants of Endor and its towns, and the inhabitants of Taanach and its towns, and the inhabitants of Megiddo and its towns.
verses.ct: Within the territories of Issachar and Asher, Manasseh also held Beth-shean and its surrounding towns, Ibleam and its towns, and the people of Dor, Endor, Taanach, and Megiddo with all their surrounding towns — 3 regions in all.

verses.kjv: Yet the children of Manasseh could not drive out the inhabitants of those cities; but the Canaanites would dwell in that land.
verses.web: Yet the children of Manasseh couldn’t drive out the inhabitants of those cities; but the Canaanites would dwell in that land.
verses.ct: But the people of Manasseh couldn't drive out the inhabitants of those cities. The Canaanites were determined to stay in that land.

verses.kjv: Yet it came to pass, when the children of Israel were waxen strong, that they put the Canaanites to tribute, but did not utterly drive them out.
verses.web: When the children of Israel had grown strong, they put the Canaanites to forced labor, and didn’t utterly drive them out.
verses.ct: Later, when the Israelites grew stronger, they forced the Canaanites into hard labor — but they never completely drove them out.

verses.kjv: And the children of Joseph spake unto Joshua, saying, Why hast thou given me but one lot and one portion to inherit, seeing I am a great people, forasmuch as the LORD hath blessed me hitherto?
verses.web: The children of Joseph spoke to Joshua, saying, “Why have you given me just one lot and one part for an inheritance, since we are a numerous people, because LORD has blessed us so far?”
verses.ct: The descendants of Joseph came to Joshua and complained, "Why have you given us only one allotment of land? We're a huge people — the LORD has blessed us and made us numerous!"

verses.kjv: And Joshua answered them, If thou be a great people, then get thee up to the wood country, and cut down for thyself there in the land of the Perizzites and of the giants, if mount Ephraim be too narrow for thee.
verses.web: Joshua said to them, “If you are a numerous people, go up to the forest, and clear land for yourself there in the land of the Perizzites and of the Rephaim; since the hill country of Ephraim is too narrow for you.”
verses.ct: Joshua replied, "If you're such a large people, then go up into the forested hill country and clear land for yourselves in the territory of the Perizzites and the Rephaim — since the hill country of Ephraim is too small for you."

verses.kjv: And the children of Joseph said, The hill is not enough for us: and all the Canaanites that dwell in the land of the valley have chariots of iron, both they who are of Bethshean and her towns, and they who are of the valley of Jezreel.
verses.web: The children of Joseph said, “The hill country is not enough for us. All the Canaanites who dwell in the land of the valley have chariots of iron, both those who are in Beth Shean and its towns, and those who are in the valley of Jezreel.”
verses.ct: The descendants of Joseph protested, "The hill country isn't enough for us! And all the Canaanites living down in the valley have iron chariots — both those in Beth-shean and its towns and those in the valley of Jezreel."

verses.kjv: And Joshua spake unto the house of Joseph, even to Ephraim and to Manasseh, saying, Thou art a great people, and hast great power: thou shalt not have one lot only:
verses.web: Joshua spoke to the house of Joseph, that is, to Ephraim and to Manasseh, saying, “You are a numerous people, and have great power. You shall not have one lot only;
verses.ct: Joshua spoke to the tribes of Ephraim and Manasseh together: "You are a large and powerful people. You won't be limited to just one allotment.

verses.kjv: But the mountain shall be thine; for it is a wood, and thou shalt cut it down: and the outgoings of it shall be thine: for thou shalt drive out the Canaanites, though they have iron chariots, and though they be strong.
verses.web: but the hill country shall be yours. Although it is a forest, you shall cut it down, and it’s farthest extent shall be yours; for you shall drive out the Canaanites, though they have chariots of iron, and though they are strong.”
verses.ct: The hill country will be yours. Yes, it's covered with forest, but you'll clear it, and all of it will belong to you. You will drive out the Canaanites, even though they have iron chariots and are strong."
